newsitem.title: JAPAN: JGC wins order from Eastman Chem Singapore unit.
newsitem.headline: JGC wins order from Eastman Chem Singapore unit.

text.p: Japanese plant engineering firm JGC Corp said on Thursday that it had received an order from a Singapore unit of U.S. chemical firm Eastman Chemical.
JGC will build an oxo chemical manufacturing complex in Pulau Sakra in Singapore for Eastman Chemical Singapore Pte Ltd, JGC said in a statement.

The project includes plants for three speciality oxo products that are used for resins and materials for coating, JGC said. It also includes a plant capable of producing 150,000 tonnes of oxo aldehydes a year, JGC said.
Oxo describes the production of alcohols and other oxygenated organic compounds.
JGC said it would provide detailed engineering, supply equipment and materials, and construct the complex.
JGC declined to provide the value of the contract, but it said the total investment in the project by Eastman and supporting companies was expected to be more than $200 million.
The complex is expected to start operations in early 1999.
